spans.text: The chestnut-haired woman led the child upstairs.
It was getting darker and darker, but the lights in the residential building were very limited, and obviously not everyone had the right to get off work now.
(They're really busy.)
Saying that, the conscientious driver waiting downstairs didn't have too many feelings in her heart, but instead took out her phone decisively.
Writing lyrics based on scenery and feeling sad about spring and autumn has never been her strength, and it is a privilege to create lyrics that can move her.
The screen lit up, she glanced at the subscribed messages, plugged in her headphones, and skillfully clicked on the link.
A moment later, a chestnut-gold figure reappeared downstairs.
Where is the car parked...
The Toyota Century has a low-key color scheme, and is silent in the twilight with the part-time driver. And the white-collar worker's eyesight is not very good.

Fortunately, the bright pink is too eye-catching in a space without children. Soyo Nagasaki squinted and looked around, finally capturing the abrupt bright color, and a friend who frowned for 20 hours a day.
What are you looking at, Taki?
Ha—uh, nothing.
It was too late to hide. The bright pink was too eye-catching in a space without children.
Why do you always like to appear like this.
So you were watching Anon's live stream. Why are you so serious? What did she do again?
(What do you mean what did she do again? Has Soyo seen a compilation of this guy's live broadcast accidents?)
Despite complaining in her heart, the loyal friend still swiped up the soaring messages one by one and pointed them out to her rarely curious teammate.
The drummer's movements were very fast, so fast that it seemed deliberate to make people unable to see what the fleeting messages were. What's more, the observer's eyesight is not outstanding.
Even so, understanding certain things does not entirely depend on the eyes. MyGO!!!!!'s bassist still saw quite a few voices urging for a Live.
The office worker remembered the plane ticket she had just booked yesterday, flying to Hokkaido next week.
In this regard, Taki Shiina is always the most innocent of them.

That's not how I remember it. In the past, there were people who mentioned MyGO!!!!! in Anon Chihaya's live stream, but it was rare to have one or two in a stream. After all, their activity frequency is almost comparable to a dormant volcano.

But the reason is not difficult to guess. The bassist, who is with the drummer, secretly examines the expression of this rock band's leader. Today, she is not wearing makeup, and she is not as energetic as in the two-person co-frame clip.
...Although she may be forced to be energetic. After all, she was pulled over by that guy to do business.
Do you usually watch her live streams?
No.
This person's title is "Idiot Pink Hair". Anon said in her live stream that she doesn't like to be called that. It's too much, even if they donate money.
That's really impolite... but Anon probably finds it difficult to say it directly as a streamer, and probably pretends not to see it.
That won't do.
The bassist glanced at her and took out her phone. Her old friend of many years has long been accustomed to her indignation - an almost argumentative conversation is part of their communication.
Then I'll send a red Super Chat to cover it up.

Taki hurriedly grabbed her wrist, trying to stop this overbearing, nouveau riche behavior. Although she still forgets that her mouth can be used to speak when she is nervous, at least she won't grab her collar in a red-faced rage like she did in her adolescence.
Soyo Nagasaki obediently put down her phone, even though she didn't even turn it on.
Was Taki's class today smooth? Are the students naughty? Were you late leaving in the morning?
...Huh?
Why did the topic suddenly come here?
It's all okay.
That's right. Taki is really amazing, she can handle any job well, and she is always on time.
Our company often deducts bonuses from newcomers for being late, and there are always people complaining in private that their wages are not enough to spend.
What are you trying to say?
So Taki is going to pay to settle things?

Twisting and turning. The troublesome person and her troublesome way of speaking. Hunters who have maxed out their social skills always like to lure people into a trap. Taki Shiina always falls into the trap again and again.
But unfortunately, this time it was letting a wolf into the house.
Taki Shiina, who had been dizzy for a long time, finally became confident and justified.
I didn't say I wanted to leave a message, just block or report them.

Although I can't stand it, I don't plan to always use money to solve it. After all, it's impossible for me to stare at every live stream. The situation is not that serious, Anon can handle it herself.
We are not her parents, why interfere in everything, don't spoil her too much.
The hunter who missed her target clenched her sleeves.
It's getting dark, and it's not good to be parked downstairs for too long. Let's go.
It was already dark when we came, right?
The kind-hearted drummer complained in her heart, but finally did not press her advantage. For people who are both sensitive and thin-skinned, you can't corner them too much.
So the driver naturally opened the back seat door first.
The car started smoothly, without her familiar rumble, and she didn't have to sit in place waiting for the engine to warm up.
The road was wide, and the driver didn't need to be nervous and focused, and she didn't need to stick her head out to confirm how far the wall was from the rearview mirror. She just had to drive.
The car music hadn't started yet, and the safe driver took off her headphones, away from the electronic harassment of the YouTube streamer, and the world was quiet.
Little Tomori also spoils little Anon, and you always indulge little Tomori.
The driver drove into the twilight, without looking sideways.
The passenger in the back seat didn't have any extra words after firing a cold shot. The car audio took over the conversation and filled the silent space.

Just as she was driving out of the community entrance, Taki was still thinking about whether she should take responsibility for the communication; however, once she merged into the rush hour traffic, she couldn't spare that much thought.

The red light, which seemed to be getting longer and longer in front of the long line of cars, lit up. The driver slowly reduced her speed, trying not to wake the lady who was taking a nap in the back seat.
Where are we?
Ineffective effort.
Are you awake?
...Not asleep.
Where to?
Your house.
(Don't you have an appointment with me? Of course we're going to your place.)
Then how will you get back?
(We won't be chatting for too long, right? It's impossible to miss the train. I can just go back myself.)
Taki really wanted to say what she was thinking, but Soyo would never treat her work like this.

Even in band matters, when Soyo really needs to take over, this troublesome old friend will sigh and arrange the schedule clearly. Why isn't it like this when it comes to herself? Does the thinking capacity suddenly get cut off when the two of them are together?
But during the red light, the driver raised her eyes and glanced at the passenger's expression in the car's rearview mirror, and chose to read the air.
She sighed, trying to soften her tone, so that what she was about to say didn't sound like a complaint, but a sincere suggestion.
If you have any plans, tell me now.
The person leaning on the back seat closed her eyes again, avoiding the inclusive and familiar eye contact in the car's rearview mirror. Now is not the time to be on the Live stage.
Can you turn at the next intersection?
